Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Used an account at a financial institution to pay utility bills, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report making a payment in the past 12 months for water, electricity, or trash collection directly from an account at a bank or another type of financial institution (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Used an account at a financial institution to receive government transfers, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report using their accounts at a formal financial institution to receive money or payments from the government in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Used an account at a financial institution to receive remittances, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report using their accounts at a formal financial institution to receive money from family members living elsewhere in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Used an account at a financial institution to receive wages, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report using their accounts at a formal financial institution to receive money or payments for work or from selling goods in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Used an account at a financial institution to send remittances, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report using their accounts at a formal financial institution to send money to family members living elsewhere in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Used an account to make a transaction through a mobile phone, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report making a transaction with money from their account at a bank or another type of financial institution using a mobile phone in the past 12 months. This can include using a mobile phone to make payments, to make purchases, or to send or receive money (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Used an account to receive government transfers, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report receiving any financial support from the government directly into an account at a bank or another type of financial institution, into a card, or through a mobile phone in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Used an account to receive wages, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report receiving a salary or wages directly into an account at a bank or another type of financial institution, into a card, or through a mobile phone in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Used checks to make payments, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who used checks in the past 12 months to make payments on bills or to buy things using money from their accounts (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Used electronic payments to make payments, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who used electronic payments (payments that one makes or that are made automatically including wire transfers or payments made online) in the past 12 months to make payments on bills or to buy things using money from their accounts (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Used the Internet to pay bills or buy things, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report paying bills or making purchases online using the Internet in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Vulnerable employment, female (% of female employment)
Long definition: Vulnerable employment is unpaid family workers and own-account workers as a percentage of total employment.
Source: International Labour Organization, Key Indicators of the Labour Market database.

Indicator Name: Wage and salaried workers, female (% of female employment)
Long definition: Wage and salaried workers (employees) are those workers who hold the type of jobs defined as paid employment jobs
Source: where the incumbents hold explicit (written or oral) or implicit employment contracts that give them a basic remuneration that is not directly dependent upon the revenue of the unit for which they work.
column5: International Labour Organization, Key Indicators of the Labour Market database.
